title: BBC Local Live: Stoke & Staffordshire on Monday 30 November 2015 - BBC News
summary: hs2 junction in south staffordshire proposed by government .
jcb boss 'applauds ' workers for shorter hours agreement .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for staffordshire and cheshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 tuesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: hs2 analysis : silver linings for stoke-on-trent
text: the news today about crewe officially getting an hs2 station is clearly a blow for stoke-on-trent , which staged a rival bid to host a hub , and even threatened legal action if it failed .
but a recent cross-border deal struck in october is meant to see thousands of the jobs and new homes resulting from hs2 redirected down the a500 into the potteries .
now the government and cheshire officials say they 're committed to making sure north staffordshire feels the benefits of high speed rail .
author: Phil McCann
Political reporter, Cheshire

documents.title: on midlands today this evening : record sales predictions for cyber monday
text: how 's your mouse bearing up ?
i 'm only asking because we 're told that today is cyber monday and , much like black friday turned out to be , it 's all about online shopping
it 's forecast to be the busiest internet shopping day of the year and we 'll be examining the impact on the region in midlands today on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: Nick Owen
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : port vale manager relieved at week off
text: port vale boss rob page says it is a relief to have a full week of recovery before their next game .
the valiants have had a backlog of fixtures with saturday 's defeat to rochdale being their fifth game in two weeks .
page believes it is important for the vale to make the most of the week off .
we 've got to make the most of it because the amount of games that they 've had , there 's a lot of fatigue .
author: Lee Blakeman
Port Vale commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: watch : getting bowled over in stafford
text: you 'll be able to enjoy a game of bowls in stafford throughout the whole of winter this year .
the borough council 's agreed to open the green in the town 's victoria park for a pilot winter season .
i went along and had a go myself as you can see - apparently i 've got a `` perfect action '' !
author: John Acres
BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: watch : tonight 's weather forecast for stoke and staffordshire
text: the rain will start to clear in the first part of tonight before more arrives before dawn .
breezy with lows of 6c ( 43f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: hs2 : transport secretary promises benefits to stoke-on-trent
text: the transport secretary , patrick mcloughlin , has told the house of commons he 's asked hs2 ltd to explore the idea of a junction at handsacre in south staffordshire , to serve stoke-on-trent .
he was responding to an urgent question from the stoke central labour mp tristham hunt about how his city will benefit .
it comes after today 's announcement that building work will start on the line in the next couple of years in crewe .
what is absolutely essential i believe is that stoke-on-trent gets a benefit from hs2 as does the whole area of north staffordshire and that south part of cheshire .
author: Lee Thomas
News Editor, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: your autumn colours keele university chapel
text: this autumnal of buildings at keele university 's chapel has been shared with me by yunmintan on instagram .
i try to feature as many of your photos of staffordshire or cheshire as i can so keep sending them in .
you can email , tweet @ twitterid or use instagram .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : hs2 - chancellor says stoke wo n't miss out
text: chancellor george osborne says stoke-on-trent will benefit from the hs2 link going from birmingham to crewe .
today he 's been in cheshire to officially announce that crewe will be the next key staging post on the route to manchester , opening in 2027 .
but he said on his visit to the area that the potteries wo n't be left out .
i give people in stoke my personal commitment that we 'll make sure stoke gets all the benefits .
author: Phil McCann
Political reporter, Cheshire

documents.title: travel : multi-vehicle crash on a50 in stoke-on-trent
text: the a50 in stoke-on-trent has a lane closed on the entry slip road and there 's slow traffic westbound at the sideway roundabout .
it 's because of an accident , a multi-vehicle accident and recovery work - congestion is back to the meir tunnel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: sheep gets 'stuck ' on the side of a canal in cheshire
text: a sheep needed rescuing by firefighters this morning in south cheshire after getting `` stuck '' on the side of a canal , the fire service says .
cheshire fire and rescue service says it was in astbury and it was returned to a nearby field .
author: Lamont Howie
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: latest news : government suggests staffordshire hs2 junction , jcb workers 'applauded ' for agreement and homeless help urged in stoke
text: this evening 's main headlines include
- the transport secretary says he 's asked hs2 ltd to explore the idea of a junction in south staffordshire , to serve stoke-on-trent
- digger maker jcb 's chief executive says workers who voted for shorter hours to avoid lay-offs should `` be applauded for their actions ''
- rough sleepers in stoke-on-trent need urgent help before the winter gets worse according to a group of volunteers
author: Mike Perkins
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: bystanders who came to the rescue of man in coleshill praised
text: paramedics have praised bystanders for coming to the aid of a man who suffered a cardiac arrest in coleshill .
author: Tamworth Herald

documents.title: picture : shugborough 's autumnal coating
text: autumn 's come to the driveway at the shugborough historic estate .
the long and winding road shugborough 's main drive looking lovely # mondaymotivation # autumn @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid perfect for those winter walks - we love the sound of the leaves crunching beneath our feet !

documents.title: 'disappointment ' over hs2 decision from stoke-on-trent deputy
text: the deputy leader of stoke-on-trent city council 's tweeted her response to hs2 having a station at crewe and not stoke-on-trent .
disappointed on hs2 decision over station however pleased govn recognise importance of # stokeontrent connectivity & partnership work 1/2

documents.title: football : butland backs team-mate johnson england recall
text: stoke city 's england goalkeeper jack butland says that potters team-mate glen johnson deserves an england recall .
johnson has not figured for england boss roy hodgson since winning his 54th cap at the 2014 world cup in brazil .
he 's up against some brilliant full-backs , nathaniel clyne and kyle walker .
and it is up to the manager .
but , if he keeps performing well , who knows .
author: Matt Sandoz
Stoke City commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: workers at digger maker jcb 'applauded ' for agreeing to work fewer hours
text: digger maker jcb 's chief executive says workers who have voted for shorter hours to avoid compulsory redundancies should `` be applauded for their actions '' .
the staffordshire firm - which has eight factories in staffordshire - announced plans for 290 redundancies earlier this month .
however , following consultations with the gmb union , more than 100 shop floor jobs are set to be saved .
jcb and the gmb were determined to do everything possible to avoid compulsory redundancies .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News Online

documents.title: stone 's darkest ever christmas remembered at tree festival
text: stone 's darkest ever christmas will be remembered at the st michael 's church christmas tree festival this weekend .
author: A Little Bit Of Stone

documents.title: travel : slow after accident on m6 near stafford
text: on the m6 northbound there'sslow traffic at junction 14 , because of an earlier accident on the exit slip road ,
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: your a scenic stockton brook
text: this gorgeous photo of stockton brook 's been shared with me on instagram by miss lucifer .
you can also share your photos of staffordshire and cheshire with me on instagram , just add # bbcstoke to the description so i can see them .
or you can send them in on email or tweet @ twitterid
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hs2 : former council boss 'deeply disappointed ' link going to crewe
text: the former leader of stoke-on-trent city council , labour 's mohammed pervez has told the bbc he 's `` deeply disappointed that hs2 is n't coming '' to the city .
today the chancellor 's confirmed the crewe to birmingham link will open in 2027 - a blow for stoke-on-trent , where the city council had staged a rival bid .
it was led at the time by mr pervez , who lost control of the authority after may 's elections .
we now need to ensure that it gets the best out of hs2 at all costs , because the future of our city depends on this .
author: James Bovill
Political reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: travel : flooding warning on some cheshire routes
text: warning of flooding on some roads in cheshire east .
keep up to date with bbc travel .
we are currently dealing with over 40 flooding issues across the borough , please drive with caution .
# workingforyou
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest news : benefits of crewe 's hs2 link to be spread ; 100+ lay-offs avoided at jcb ; and £ 20,000 for alton towers rescuers
text: this afternoon 's staffordshire and cheshire main headlines include
- economic benefits from the high-speed rail link coming to crewe will be shared with neighbouring councils , cheshire east council says
- an announcement that jcb staff have voted to work shorter hours to avoid lay-offs is labelled `` a magnanimous act '' by the gmb union
- two victims of the alton towers rollercoaster crash have raised £ 20,000 for the support services who helped rescue them
author: Mike Perkins
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: call for more winter homeless help in stoke-on-trent
text: volunteers trying to help rough sleepers in stoke-on-trent say they fear some wo n't make it through the winter if they do n't get urgent help .
help for homeless was set up just a few weeks ago - it serves food and supplies , warm clothing , blankets and tents for vulnerable people in hanley .
most of it is hidden from folk .
if you walk into the city centre today and you 're going into work or shopping , you wo n't see very much of it .
author: Alice Bentley
BBC Local Live

documents.title: m6 toll cash will help burntwood guides get outdoors
text: burntwood guides have more money for outdoor activities thanks to a £ 250 donation from operators of the m6 toll midland expressway limited ( mel ) .
author: Lichfield Mercury

documents.title: football : goal glut could ignite burton 's season
text: burton albion manager jimmy floyd hasselbaink hopes timmy thiele 's first competitive goal for the club will lead to many more .
striker thiele , a summer signing from borussia dortmund , scored at the 19th attempt on saturday in the brewers ' 5-1 thrashing of managerless colchester .
they 're still the lowest scorers among the top eight teams in league one , but hasselbaink thinks the goal rush will be a boost for his side 's confidence .
author: Nigel Cash
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: cabbie 's jaw is broken in 'attack ' after trouble erupts outside pub
text: two men were last night being questioned by police after a taxi driver was left with a broken jaw following a dispute outside a city pub .
author: The Sentinel

documents.title: hs2 : cheshire east pledges to share the benefits of crewe link
text: any economic growth and benefits from the high-speed rail link coming to crewe will be shared with neighbouring councils , the leader of cheshire east council says .
today it 's been announced by the government that the hs2 route from crewe to birmingham will open six years earlier than planned , in 2027 .
cheshire east council says it 's going to set up a new regeneration company to `` deliver an economic growth strategy '' for the area .
we want to reach out to our neighbouring local authorities and see the growth and benefits spread to them as well .
author: Phil McCann
Political reporter, Cheshire

documents.title: union says jcb staff vote to avoid lay-offs 'a magnanimous act '
text: today 's announcement that jcb staff have voted to work shorter hours to avoid compulsory redundancies has been called `` a magnanimous act '' by the gmb union .

the staffordshire-based firm says a proposal from the company and the union - for flexible working patterns until the end of february to save more than 100 jobs - has been accepted by shop floor workers .
over 100 people who were under threat of compulsory redundancy will now have a much happier christmas .
author: Jack Dowling
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: three people were taken to hospital after a car crash in burton
text: a burton car crash led to two people being taken to hospital .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: your christmas procession in newcastle-under-lyme
text: this come from the bbc 's chris king , who was in newcastle-under-lyme yesterday .
he says churches and voluntary groups were pushing decorated shopping trolleys through the streets before singing carols by the guild hall .
you can send your in on email , tweet @ twitterid or use instagram .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : weather forecast for stoke and staffordshire
text: staying very windy this afternoon with plenty of rain - and this could occasionally be heavy .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : crewe alex 's adam king looking for longer loan deal
text: crewe alexandra 's match winner at the weekend , adam king , says he would like to extend his stay when his loan spell ends in january .
the swansea loanee scored his fifth goal of the season in the1-0 win over oldham and king says he 's enjoying his time at the club .
author: Graham McGarry
Crewe Alexandra commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: alton towers victims ' charity night raises more than £ 20,000
text: one of the victims of the alton towers rollercoaster crash says a charity night , in aid of the organisations that helped them , has raised more than £ 20,000 .
leah washington , 18 , and joe pugh , 19 , both from barnsley , were among four people badly injured on the smiler ride on 2 june when two carriages crashed .
they held the event at the metrodome arena in barnsley earlier this month and over the weekend joe revealed the amount raised .
i ca n't remember if i tweeted already or not , pretty much everyone now knows , we raised a approx amount of over 20k at our charity event !
@ twitterid @ twitterid wow ! !
amazing amount ! !
# inspirationalcouple
@ twitterid @ twitterid wow that 's amazing well done joe xx
@ twitterid that 's fantastic .
well done
@ twitterid @ twitterid well done guys that 's is amazing ! ! !
wow xx
@ twitterid that 's brilliant .
i know it does n't change the circumstances but its lovely that there is a so much admiration for the rescuers x
@ twitterid brilliant achievement for such a fab cause , good on you !
@ twitterid well done that 's amazing
@ twitterid wow congratulations brilliant amount of money
@ twitterid what you and leah have achieved out of something terrible , is truly amazing your inspirational , courageous lovely role models x
@ twitterid superb work that .
what a way to give back & say thanks .
@ twitterid wow that is so amazing well done joe xx
author: Ros Chimes
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: cash boost for tamworth conservation sites
text: tamworth 's conservation areas have receiveda welcome winter bonuswith extra cash from tame valley wetlands .
author: Tamworth Herald

documents.title: watch : christmas tree festival in alsager
text: hope you had a good weekend - for me , an invitation to the christmas tree festival was too good to pass up and i took this quick video .
author: Tim Wedgwood
Presenter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: travel : accident on a34 in newcastle-under-lyme
text: the a34 talke road in newcastle-under-lyme is partially blocked and there 's slow traffic northbound at the parkhouse road east junction .
it 's because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: hs2 announcment : 'bitter blow ' to staffordshire communities , says council
text: as the chancellor george osborne announces crewe is getting it 's hs2 station six years early , staffordshire county council says it 'll aim to get the best deal for the county .
the proposed link between the town and birmingham is now set to open in 2027 .
in staffordshire , hs2 is set to run through several woodland sites and communities .
this next phase to crewe will cut through a further 33 miles of staffordshire countryside and today 's news will undoubtedly be a bitter blow to those communities lying along its route .
author: Emma Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: travel : flooding reports on b5074 near nantwich
text: there are reports of flooding in the nantwich area say cheshire police .
we are taking reports of flooding on the b5074 , church minshull heading towards nantwich .
please avoid if possible
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather watcher : raining in hednesford
text: i 've this today by bbc weather watcher thornhill watch , from hednesford - where this morning it was rainy and 7c ( 45f ) .
if you want to become a bbc weather watcher there 's more on the website .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: on bbc radio stoke today : have you planned your funeral ?
text: today i want to know what 's going to happen when you die ?
have you made a plan ?

it 's after i read this story on the bbc website about the cost of so-called `` paupers ' funerals '' rising - which are carried out by local authorities for people who die alone or without relatives able to pay .
so have you got a plan ?
get involved on email or tweet @ twitterid
author: Perry Spiller
Presenter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: hs2 will go ahead six years early as county council vows to get best deal
text: the hs2 plans which will see a high speed railway line cutting through stafford countryside is to be delivered six years early - and staffordshire county council has today vowed to secure the best deal for the county .
author: Staffordshire Newsletter

documents.title: watch : the morning 's headlines from bbc radio stoke
text: here 's how newsreader jodie looker brought the latest headlines for staffordshire and cheshire to bbc radio stoke listeners .
author: Jodie Looker
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: breakingjcb staff vote for shorter hours to avoid compulsory lay-offs
text: staff at staffordshire-based jcb have voted to work shorter hours for the next three months to avoid more than 100 compulsory redundancies , the firm says .
earlier this month the digger-maker had said up to 290 jobs were at risk due to tough trading conditions - that number was reduced to 235 after consultations .

jcb says it and the gmb union had proposed a flexible working pattern for shop floor employees until the end of february to save more than 100 jobs - which they say was passed at a vote of members which ended on friday .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cyclist hurt in a34 talke crash dies
text: a 20-year-old cyclist who was seriously injured in an accident on the a34 near talke last week has died , say police .
staffordshire police says michal zygiert , of gordon road in goldenhill , stoke-on-trent , was involved in the crash with a car in the early hours of wednesday .
police say their investigation 's continuing and his family are being supported by specialist officers .
author: Lee Thomas
News Editor, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: councils up £ 1.7m bill for 'paupers ' funerals '
text: the cost to local councils - including in the north west and west midlands - of so-called `` paupers ' funerals '' has risen almost 30 % to £ 1.7m in the past four years .
the number of these funerals has also risen by 11 % , a freedom of information request by bbc local radio revealed .
overall , north-west england has the greatest number of public health funerals - among the biggest increases was a significant rise in the west midlands .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: latest headlines : crewe to get hs2 station early ; cyclist dies days after talke crash ; and volunteers want more homeless help
text: this morning 's top stories for the area include
- crewe is getting its hs2 station six years early - the chancellor george osborne will make the official announcement today
- a 20-year-old cyclist who was seriously injured in an accident on the a34 near talke last week has died
- volunteers trying to help rough sleepers in stoke-on-trent fear some wo n't make it through the winter if they do n't get urgent help
author: Jodie Looker
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: hs2 line to open six years early but funding soars to £ 55bn
text: the controversial hs2 rail line which will cut through miles of staffordshire countryside is set to open six years ahead of schedule , the chancellor announced today .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: football : stoke looking to 'bounce back ' without skipper
text: the stoke city manager mark hughes says tomorrow 's league cup tie against sheffield wednesday is the perfect opportunity for his side to bounce back from saturday 's defeat .
the potters had captain ryan shawcross sent off in the 2-0 loss at sunderland , which means he 'll miss the match .
hughes says the absence of shawcross will be a huge blow .
my thinking leading into the games has obviously changed now because of ryan 's absence .
author: Matt Sandoz
Stoke City commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: your crewe 's all lit up for christmas
text: this of the crewe christmas tree and lights on the town square 's come from jonathan white , after last week 's switch-on .
it 's great to get your of staffordshire and cheshire , so keep sharing them .
youcan email me , tweet @ twitterid instagram ( just add # bbcstoke to the description so i can find them ) .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : fallen telegraph pole on a5192 in lichfield
text: the a5192 cappers lane in lichfield is shut both ways near the austin cote lane junction , because of recovery work and a fallen telegraph pole .
there 's a diversion in operation .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: a34 death : trucker 's fight to save cyclist
text: lorry driver dave whitehurst has told how he battled to save a dying cyclist after coming across a late-night horror crash .
author: The Sentinel

documents.title: latest news : hs2 section to open six years early ; call for more homeless help in stoke ; and cyclist dies days after crash
text: the top stories this morning for staffordshire and cheshire include :
- the high-speed railway connecting crewe to birmingham will open six years ahead of schedule , chancellor george osborne confirms
- rough sleepers in stoke-on-trent need urgent help before the winter gets worse , according to a group of volunteers in the city
- a 20-year-old cyclist who was seriously injured in an accident on the a34 near talke last week has died , say police
author: Jodie Looker
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: hs2 : crewe to birmingham link to open six years early
text: the proposed high-speed rail link between crewe and birmingham will be opened six years earlier than planned , in 2027 , chancellor george osborne has said .
improving transport links with the north is a key part of the government 's transport policy .
the treasury said journey times between crewe and london would be cut by 45 minutes once the new route was open .
high-speed rail will play a big role in connecting up the entire region with the rest of the country
author: Phil McCann
Political reporter, Cheshire

documents.title: watch : latest weather for stoke and staffordshire
text: a generally poor start to the week weather-wise with strong winds , plenty of rain - and this could occasionally be heavy .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : lane closure on a500 in stoke-on-trent
text: there 's a lane shut on the a500 d road southbound in longport between porthill bank and wolstanton retail park , because of a police incident .
congestion is back to talke roundabout .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning and welcome to today 's live coverage for stoke and staffordshire
text: it 's a wet start to the weather in hanley as you can see from this i took before 07:30 in the rain .
charlie slater will be here with a full forecast shortly and we 'll have the latest news , sport , travel and your through the day .
you can get involved on email , twitter , facebook and instagram .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live
